headline.main: Canadians Going to Aid Alaska Were Asked to Pay Duty on Arms; CANADIANS' ARMS ALASKA TAX ISSUE

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 30 -- This is a story that can now be told of how Secretary of State Cordell Hull, with consummate diplomacy, saved the situation when United States customs officials demanded that Canadian military forces, moving hurriedly into Alaska to strengthen defenses in connection with the Japanese landings in the Aleutians, pay duty to the United States on their spare uniforms and their fighting equipment.
abstract: Alaska: Canadians aiding US forces termed distinguished visitors by Sec Hull to escape duty payments when crossing border
